para.text: The Criminal Justice Coordinating Council shall include the following members:
Mayor, District of Columbia (Chair);
Chairman, Council of the District of Columbia;
Chairperson, Judiciary Committee, Council of the District of Columbia;
Chief Judge, Superior Court of the District of Columbia;
Chief, Metropolitan Police Department;
Director, Department of Corrections;
Attorney General for the District of Columbia;
Director, Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services;
Director, Public Defender Service;
Director, Pretrial Services Agency;
Director, Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency;
United States Attorney for the District of Columbia;
Repealed;
Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons;
Chair, United States Parole Commission;
Repealed;
Repealed;
The United States Marshal, Superior Court of the District of Columbia;
Executive Director, Office of Victim Services and Justice Grants;
Executive Director, Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement; and
Director, Office of Gun Violence Prevention.
Repealed.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 106 of the Omnibus Criminal Code Amendment Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-44, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5381, 20 DCSTAT 1281).
For temporary amendment of (a) and repeal of (b), see § 106 of the Omnibus Criminal Code Amendments Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-599, January 14, 2013, 60 DCR 1017).
For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 1404 of Fiscal Year 2002 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-124, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7861).

The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-320 substituted “Attorney General for the District of Columbia” for “Corporation Counsel for the District of Columbia” in (a)(7); substituted “Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services” for “Department of Human Services’ Youth Rehabilitation Services” in (a)(8); repealed (a)(13), (a)(16), and (a)(17); added (a)(18) and made related changes; and repealed (b), which read: “Membership of the Authority members shall expire upon the dissolution of the Authority.”
